title: British tourist arrested in Abu Dhabi for 'swearing at the police and airport staff' because he had missed his flight
text:
4
View
comments
A British holidaymaker was arrested at Abu Dhabi Airport after allegedly swearing at security forces and members of staff because he had missed his flight.
The man, who has not been named, was travelling from London Heathrow to India when he had to change at Abu Dhabi. However, delays from the UK airport meant he missed his connection.
Despite his flight been closed, he demanded to be allowed onto the plane, and is reported to have verbally abused a member of staff as well as make offensive remarks about UAE.
The man was arrested at Abu Dhabi Airport after he started swearing at staff because he missed his flight
Gulf News have reported that the man also held up other passengers as he argued with officials, and that he also 'waved his British passport around'.
He claimed he did not recognise that the people advising him were security officials. Witnesses to the incident however say that their identification was clearly on show written in English and Arabic.

Surprise for passengers at London City Airport as... They have also said that he was told the people were security, yet he continued shouting and swearing.
He also says he was not swearing at the police but 'at himself' in anger at missing his flight.
The man's actions saw him hold up other passengers who were flying out of Abu Dhabi airport
Emirates 24/7 reported that two police officers asked the passenger to sit down and be patient until they figure out how to help him, but he 'started swearing at the officers using vulgar obscene words, swore against the UAE.'
MailOnline Travel has contacted Abu Dhabi Airport and the police, and is waiting for a response.
